intro: Catha montana, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a shrub or small tree native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, white flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains seeds used in traditional medicine and as a stimulant. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
